title: Epic 83-day cruise to South America to sail but you need £17,000 to be on board
text:

Adventurers, 2021 could be the year you tick off a whole host of destinations from the bucket list!

Saga, the over 50s travel firm, has just unveiled a seriously glamorous new cruise on new ship Spirit of Discovery that will sail around South America - for 83 days.

We're talking destinations across Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, Falkland Islands, Chile, Peru, Ecuador, Panama, Colombia and Curacao, on a return journey from Southampton.

Unsurprisingly there are heaps of highlights too, but those that caught our attention included the cruise along the Amazon River and getting up close to the spectacular rainforest, transiting the Panama Canal and stopping off at hotspots from Rio de Janeiro in Brazil to Ushuaia in Argentina.

There will also be optional tours to the Galapagos Islands and Machu Picchu. (You can check out the full list of destinations below).

(Image: iStockphoto)

It sounds utterly dreamy, although the price tag will quickly bring you back to reality.

That's because the epic South America: A Grand Voyage cruise will set you back £17,324 for a balcony cabin.

The silver lining? It's an all-inclusive sailing, encompassing your accommodation, chauffeur service to the port, all-inclusive drinks and meals, daily afternoon tea, onboard gratuities, free wifi and optional travel insurance.

(Image: Mikel/Flickr)

It's by no means a budget-friendly holiday, but it does work out at approximately £208pp per day, so if you do happen to have the money, you can get plenty of bang for your buck.

Then of course you'll be on board Saga's brand new cruise ship Spirit of Discovery which took to the seas earlier this year. Think luxurious cabins, a cosy library, luxury spa and impressive theatre - cruise fans can take a sneak peek inside.

The ship boasts a gross tonnage of 58,250 gross and holds less than 1,000 passengers to make for a serene setting.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

description: Saga's new South America cruise on Spirit of Discovery has the most amazing itinerary but you'll need a big budget
